div.div: Educating Students. Inspiring Success. Improving Tomorrow.

div.p: Within a safe and supportive environment, we will provide every student with a strong education that will enable them to be productive citizens who are college and career ready and are able to compete in an ever-changing world.

img.alt: COVID-19 | Media Release (Meal Pick-Up, Wednesday, April 15, 2020)

h3.a: COVID-19 | Media Release (Meal Pick-Up, Wednesday, April 15,...

div.div: Please read the letter below as it contains important information for students and parents.

img.alt: COVID-19 Office Hours | From April 13th until further notice

h3.a: COVID-19 Office Hours | From April 13th until further notice...

div.div: In response to COVID-19, please be advised that Brunswick County Public Schools has adopted an essential work personnel schedule. Therefore, BCPS Central Office and School Buildings will be open every Tuesday from 8:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. until further notice.

Please take a moment to view the Parent COVID-19 At-Home Learning information included below. A paper version was sent home on Tuesday, April 7th. For additional information, please contact your child's school.

In an effort to make sure all families get important updates through School Messenger, we are asking families to update the following information.
Each household should complete 1 form and include all school aged children.

img.alt: Public Input for School Board Meetings

h3.a: Public Input for School Board Meetings

div.div:
Questions/Comments for Public Input at School Board Meetings must be emailed and/or called in to Mrs. Clary by 4:00 p.m. the Wednesday afternoon prior to the scheduled meeting.
Please contact Mrs. Clary at 434-848-3138 ext. 4003 or clarya@brunswickcps.org.
Due to the COVID-19 and the Governor’s mandated state-wide school closure, Brunswick County Public Schools’ Registration and Child Find for the 2020-2021 school year will take place via phone.

img.alt: BCPS | Closed for the Remainder of the 2019-2020 Academic School Year

h3.a: BCPS | Closed for the Remainder of the 2019-2020 Academic Sc...

div.div: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Governor Northam announced today his decision to close all public and private schools through the end of the 2019-20 academic year.

div.div: Would you rather leave a message? If so, you can place your order via the BCPS Meal Hotline at 434-848-3138 ext. 4018, by 8:00AM on Wednesday, March 25, 2020

div.div: Please read this message in its entirety. We hope that you are enjoying your spring break. As you are aware, we are closed next week due to COVID-19, Coronavirus as mandated by Governor Northam. Over the course of the next few days, you will receive calls to a...

img.alt: UPDATE: Governor Northam Order | BCPS Closed March 16-27, 2020

h3.a: UPDATE: Governor Northam Order | BCPS Closed March 16-27, 20...

div.div: Due to the increase in COVID-19, Coronavirus cases across the state of Virginia, at approximately 2:30pm today, March 13, 2020, Governor Ralph Northam has ordered school divisions to close for the next two weeks beginning March 16 through March 27, 2020. Pleas...
A comprehensive parent letter regarding COVID-19, Coronavirus is being sent home with students today. This information has been placed on the division website and social media as well.

img.alt: Dr. Somerville-Midgette receives NAACP Education Award

h3.a: Dr. Somerville-Midgette receives NAACP Education Award

div.div: Congratulations to our superintendent, Dr. Kristy Somerville-Midgette. She recently received the 2020 Brunswick County NAACP Education Award. We are extremely proud of you and thankful for your dedication to the students and staff of BCPS. #BrunswickStrong #WE...
